PROJECT.PROJECT_TITLE: Dietary methionine restriction in high-fat diet-fed male mice
PROJECT.PROJECT_SUMMARY: 25-week-old male mice (n=31) with diet-induced obesity were divided into four groups. The first group (n=8) was fed a high-fat diet (HFD, 60% kcal fat) for 15 weeks. The second, third, and fourth groups were fed a modified high-fat diet (HFD-MetR, 60% fat/0.12% methionine) for 3 days (MetR3, n=8), 5 days (MetR5, n=8), or 10 days (MetR10, n=7), respectively. The HFD group (60% fat/0.86% methionine) served as the control. Mice were fasted for 4 hours prior to sample collection. The goal of this study was to investigate the effect of methionine restriction on plasma, brown adipose, and liver metabolomes.

STUDY.STUDY_TITLE: Dietary methionine restriction in high-fat diet-fed male mice, brown adipose tissue metabolomics
STUDY.STUDY_SUMMARY: 25-week-old male mice (n=31) with diet-induced obesity were divided into four groups. The first group (n=8) was fed a high-fat diet (HFD, 60% kcal fat) for 15 weeks. The second, third, and fourth groups were fed a modified high-fat diet (HFD-MetR, 60% fat/0.12% methionine) for 3 days (MetR3, n=8), 5 days (MetR5, n=8), or 10 days (MetR10, n=7), respectively. The HFD group (60% fat/0.86% methionine) served as the control. Mice were fasted for 4 hours prior to sample collection. The goal of this study was to investigate the effect of methionine restriction on brown adipose tissues.

SUBJECT.ANIMAL_FEED: Research Diets D12492; Research Diets A14032002; Research Diets A14032001

COLLECTION.COLLECTION_SUMMARY: Brown adipose tissue samples were collected upon completion of the time course after fasting the mice for 4 h. A pooled QC sample was used for MS/MS collection.

TREATMENT.TREATMENT_SUMMARY: Mice were weight-matched and divided into two groups fed either High fat diet, HFD-control (60% fat/0.86% methionine; Research Diets A14032002) or HFD-MetR (60% fat/0.12% methionine; Research Diets A14032001). The HFD-MetR group was split into 3 groups, where the HFD-MetR was administered for 3 days (MetR3, n=8), 5 days (MetR5, n=8), or 10 days (MetR10, n=7). HFD-MetR groups were compared to each other and the control group (HFD, n=8).
TREATMENT.TREATMENT: Dietary intervention and duration of altered diet
TREATMENT.TREATMENT_DOSE: Research Diets A14032002; Research Diets A14032001
TREATMENT.TREATMENT_DOSEVOLUME: HFD-control (60% fat/0.86% methionine; Research Diets A14032002) or HFD-MetR (60% fat/0.12% methionine; Research Diets A14032001)

SAMPLEPREP.SAMPLEPREP_SUMMARY: Frozen tissue samples were homogenized with 80 μL 2:2:1 methanol:acetonitrile:water per mg tissue, centrifuged, and the supernatant was collected after a cold incubation and wash steps, then stored at -80°C. Plasma samples underwent solid-phase extraction (SPE) with sequential additions of acetonitrile:methanol and methanol:acetonitrile:water to separate polar and non-polar metabolites; polar metabolites were eluted and stored at -80°C, while non-polar metabolites were eluted using methyl tert-butyl ether:methanol, dried under nitrogen, reconstituted in isopropanol:methanol, and stored at -80°C.

CHROMATOGRAPHY.SOLVENT_A: 95% water/5% acetonitrile; 20mM ammonium bicarbonate; 0.1% ammonium hydroxide; 2.5 µM medronic acid

MS.MS_COMMENTS: MS/MS data were acquired in a data-dependent iterative fashion with a 1.3 m/z isolation window. Features were detected in LC/MS data through in-house peak detection and curation software.
MS.MS_RESULTS_FILE: ST004083_AN006761_Results.txt UNITS:log2-transformed normalized relative abundance Has m/z:Yes Has RT:Yes RT units:Minutes
